overview_of_class: This course addresses family relationships and communication processes or how members' interactions create and maintain families. Relying on a framework of family functions the course focuses on how family members accomplish the following: develop communication patterns that move across generations, manage intimacy and conflict, move through developmental stages while managing stressors, and improve their interaction patterns A major focus involves understanding how to use relational concepts to describe and make sense of the recurring patterns of communication among family members.
name: Family Communication
subject: COMM_ST
